website_summaries.verdict: AMD's Richland APUs boost clock speeds and refine power consumption.  In particular, the AMD A10-6800K is a decent, low-cost alternative to Intel's Core i3/i5 products.
pros: AMD adds support for DDR3-2133, nudges performance higher
cons: Intel still rules single-thread performance, power efficiency

customer_reviews.title: By far the most useful CPU I have ever bought and it STILL FRIGGIN WORKS.
customer_reviews.text: My Intel I7 4790k actually is the most useful one but this is second most! Right now I gave it to my mother, built her a computer from left over parts and even like 3 years after buying this CPU and overclocking it, IT STILL WORKS LIKE BRAND NEW. I absolutely recommend this CPU, its the fastest FM2+ CPU in the market, the only way you gonna get faster is by doing what I did and upgrading your socket and buying a whooole different Motherboard. This still gets the job done and unless you plan to try streaming or doing more than 1080p youll never need an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Could not be any happier!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I am glad you are reading this review because there are quite a few things I would love to share. This CPU is actually an APU, therefore, it has an Integrated Graphics card. The integrated graphics are absolutely phenomenal. Usually, I got around 35-45 fps on intensive games, and around 500 on Minecraft. As its part of a CPU, it also works phenomenally! 4.4 Ghz could not be better! Great job AMD on this one.
customer_reviews.author: StasiaZedMax

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the performance and ease of install I also ...
customer_reviews.text: very impressive ...I am very happy with the performance and ease of install I also upgraded my memory to 26 gig and while still using factory mother board and mechanical 2T. hard drive and all is well I have not experienced any of the over heating issues I have read about from other consumers...I will be purchasing a internal S.S.D soon and that will complete my personal home build that should take my streaming experience to new ultra fast levels
customer_reviews.author: Voice of Thunder FM

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU/GPU for the price
customer_reviews.text: Was looking to build a media PC for my uncle. He had strict requirements for a PC under $300 and this was the perfect solution. The CPU has no trouble running the regular office and browsing tasks, and the GPU is good enough for the occasional game as well. If you need an entry level gaming machine or a very nice media PC, I would definitely recommend an A10, but I wouldn't recommend it for those building mid to high end gaming machines. It just doesn't have enough power, and the graphics don't Crossfire with higher end AMD cards either.
customer_reviews.author: Blaise Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU
customer_reviews.text: This was the fastest cpu my motherboard could handle and it works great. I dont overclock because that cuts down on the life of the cpu. The ram I have is 8 gb ddr3 1.6 ghz and currently I have a geforce 620 vid card. My system runs great now. I bought an ASUS with an AMD dual-core with plans to upgrade the cpu because it was only a little over $400 and I didn't have much cash at the time. Couldn't be happier after this upgrade. Once I get a geforce 980, I'll be able to run Star Citizen well. Feel free to ask me any questions.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Best and fm2 apu you can buy
customer_reviews.text: AMD's premier flag ship (and last) fm2 processor. Fast, sharp. Plays most games in 1080p on medium and high settings. Pair it with fast ram for best results. Easily overclocked, though it does get VERY HOT (I overlocked mine only to 4.3GHZ and it runs around 115'F). Definitely CANNOT use the stock fan that comes in the box. I have it paired with a sapphire radeon HD 7750 gpu. Notice a little 'hanging' when there's a lot going on on the screen. Not sure if its due to bottleneck. But its neglible. Can play SC2 on ultra. Warcraft on High all while on 1080p resolution. Have not tested the integrated graphics, but I hear it's 'okay'.
customer_reviews.author: Techno Guru 2014

customer_reviews.title: I'm really glad I upgraded to 4.10Ghz
customer_reviews.text: This CPU breathed new life into my old A10. It didn't come with heat compound, but other than having to get some, I had no issues installing the chip. When I first turned on the machine, it seemed like things had to recalibrate somehow to this new and faster "brain", but after that - It's been running like a champ.I'm really glad I upgraded to 4.10Ghz.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Harris

customer_reviews.title: Solid chip and cool running.
customer_reviews.text: This is AMD's best A10 chip and it was a reasonable price. I really wanted to go with an AM3+ chip (quad, six, or eight core) but there weren't any micro ATX boards for it, so I went with the FM2 board and this chip. It runs very cool and seems to be a solid performer for what I do (Star Craft II and some photo editing). I used a separate video card, an XFX AMD Radeon HD 7750 1GB GDDR5 DVI/HDMI/DisplayPort PCI-Express so I could insure better video. I'm happy with my choice and the $200 for the chip and motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Gauthier

customer_reviews.title: Emulators and more
customer_reviews.text: Good fast processer, but if your actually planning to game with this proceser I would recomend getting a dedicated gaming card. I bought this in hopes of it mastering emulators. So far I have found that it can handle anything before about the WII generation. I can play some simple wii games but most of them will run about 25% slower than full speed ( with exceptions being Supersmash brothers brawl which I have managed to run about 98% ) other emulaters like n64, gamecube, gameboy etc seem to work perfectly as far as normal web browsing, video editing, and music recording, it seems to handle the job with ease
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Yes, Please
customer_reviews.text: While the general consensus among my friends was to wait for the (since released) Kaveri A10s, I jumped the gun and grabbed this, the best of the Richland APUs, combined with a FM2+ board so I could upgrade if I really needed to. I'm glad I did. The benchmarks do show some advantage to a Kaveri, but not a huge one, and the A10-6800K, even with stock cooling, is performing impressively well as a full-time desktop, sometime gaming system, keeping up with 1080p graphics on the admittedly not super-intensive games I've tried with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C. Ditz

customer_reviews.title: Good horsepower.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to salvage a computer I gave my son. I have built the computer as a home theater pc a while back and it ended up being a little under powered to run the games he plays, even with a good graphics card. I found this as the highest level processor that would drop into the same socket. It seems to add enough kick that he can now play Skyrim and other games with no slowdown.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Awesome performance for the money
customer_reviews.text: If you want to build a medium tier gaming machine or a very nice home theater pc this will nicely fill the bill. Installed this onto an MSI FM2-A55M-E33 mobo with some G.Skill 2133 MHz ram cards. It runs top tier games at medium settings without a hitch. Needless to say, it also plays YouTube, mp4, .mkv, etc. movie files flawlessly. GREAT VALUE and in my opinion is equal to or better than an Intel i-3.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Conley

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu, just not so much for modern day.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't hold up all that well nowadays, but I can comfortably run most stuff I need on it such as rainbow six siege and metro last light redux. I also usually host a couple minecraft servers at the same time and it seems to handle that quite well, which makes me like it.
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: APU!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this APU since the end of 2013 and can play most (if not all) games at 720p (1280x1024) at high/ultra settings with 60fps. I can play some of the older games at 1080p at low/medium settings at around 30fps too. On BF3 I'm getting around 40-60fps at medium/high settings at 1920x1080 with 1866mhz ram. I'd reccomend faster ram (2133mhz) to get more fps.
customer_reviews.author: Julien Z.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, very resistant and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, very resistant and reliable, where i live voltage is not very good, i had several issues with intel because of this. At first i was afraid to purchase this but one of my friends recommended it and i did, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent APU processor
customer_reviews.text: Excellent APU processor A10 6800K, I am running this with Asrock Extreme 4 MB 1866 memory OC 4.8 very fast reliable no errors 5*
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Alfred Pani

customer_reviews.title: this is an awesome GPU. Overclocks well 4
customer_reviews.text: If you're on a budget, this is an awesome GPU. Overclocks well 4.6 no problem. Runs a little warm so get a good cooler like the Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO and you will be good to go. Even at 4.6 it idled at 30c and maxed out at 45c running Prime95. Nowhere near as fast as my 4790K but nowhere near the price either.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU for what it does. If you want to do anything cpu intensive like a security camera system, this is not a good choice. It will rapp all 4 cores out with Blue Iris. Other than that, it works great. Plays WoW just fine etc. I am powering two monitors and couldn't be happier for the budget I set.
customer_reviews.author: kendall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Installed easy and was running the computer in less than 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very good for money.
customer_reviews.text: Got this when battlefield 1 came out. My a6 just couldnt cut it. This guy has vastly improved the performance of my pc. Would definatly recommend to someone looking for a higher middle range processor.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Not an amazing processor, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.text: An upgrade if you had a 50$ AMD processor in your computer prior. Of course it's not an amazing processor, but it does the job. Decent.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME processor. Very affordable and plays ALL my graphically ...
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME processor. Very affordable and plays ALL my graphically demanding games without a video card needed. Does my digital media conversions in a snap. Using this processor for one year now, its the best processor i've EVER used.
customer_reviews.author: Neida R.H.

customer_reviews.title: Good for budget builds. possibly consider an FX with cheap GPU
customer_reviews.text: Good for budget builds where you are 100% for sure not going to be using a dedicated graphics / video card (GPU). You may want to consider getting an FX processor (more cores), and then a cheap graphics card. For me, this is working good enough for my work computer.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Runs hot but otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: I've done a lot of testing on it and it looks like it does run a little hot sometimes, but otherwise I really like it. It's fast and relatively cheap for what you are getting. I put this on my GIGABYTE GA-F2A88XN-WIFI FM2+/FM2 A88X board for use in my mini-itx computer and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: VisibleKitten

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Gaming CPU - DOESNT SEEM LIKE A BUDGET CPU, BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is amazing. I bought the "customers also bought" motherboard and had a hard time getting them to work with each other. The GFX ability of this cpu is excellent. I had an Nvidia 9800gt and I just unplugged it and am using this now solo.
customer_reviews.author: Backwell

customer_reviews.title: Yes I LOVE this APU
customer_reviews.text: LOL 4.4 GHZ are you kidding me??? Yes I LOVE this APU. Its fast and super easy to install. Would buy again if I were to upgrade any of my others PC's.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Harper

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice to just use on your computer when being ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice to just use on your computer when being a first time builder. The ability AMD produces in this APU shows a great deal of games being available to play (though not always on ultra settings)
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from and a8-5500k noticed a little speed difference although it was quite miner. Really enjoy the overclocking capabilities of this baby seems to be the fastest CPU you can get for the fm2 socket. Word of advice to the overclockers or those looking to keep it at a stock speed make sure you get a good heat sink with this CPU, the stock heat sink it comes with does a bad job keeping it cool especially on a heavy load.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Alderman

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU
customer_reviews.text: I tend to run high-performance programs on my build and this CPU has never had so much as a single hiccup. I'd buy it again for another build. The Cooling unit that comes with it is not half-bad, but if you're going to over clock, invest and a better cooling unit. Overall, this CPU is the bomb.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cabezon

customer_reviews.title: is a good GPU for the money combining cpu speed with graphics...
customer_reviews.text: Amd manages to give you a GPU with both speed and graphics bundled ..no where near a core I7 but closer to core I3 if your just doing everyday pc work its great. Also good for editing photos and video's on an amateur scale ..
customer_reviews.author: L. R. kohlmeier

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected in HTPC
customer_reviews.text: I went from a core 2 quad to this and its fast. Its only in an HTPC but does some video converting and this thing is fast. The reduction in heat output by not having a separate video card in the HTPC has helped tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Jared The Geek

customer_reviews.title: yes for HTPC, no for main PC
customer_reviews.text: Great for a HTPC. Its not an intel but for a the price it cannot be beat especially being a APU. This is my first AMD in at least 5 builds and glad I used. I would not use this as my main CPU, nor any AMD. I'd prefer the versatility, but for something to throw under a TV, excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Hippocrates

customer_reviews.title: AMD All The Way!
customer_reviews.text: This CPU/GPU is an awesome alternative to Intel CPUs. It is important to note the increased power consumption vs Intel products. Looking at the AMD A10 6800k alone, I absolutely love the flexibility the processor offers when it comes to applications and video processing. If you want an inexpensive CPU that includes an excellent built in graphics processor then this AMD 6800k is the best option. Price vs functions the 6800k will decrease the cost associated with a CPU but drive better graphics than most entry level video cards. AMD adds support for DDR3-2133 and compares to the Radeon 8670D graphics performance. Only downside is the power consumption and heat from a 100w CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Decent Movie watcher and homeworker
customer_reviews.text: Kinda good if you're an average pc user bet don't expect miracles. If you want a cpu for gaming just go for the AM3+ FX 6300 or FX 8320 and up with a new motherboard and graphics card.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: From dual core to quad core.
customer_reviews.text: The difference is night and day, with my new processor I now have multi tasking, thanks for the right product for my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Collard

customer_reviews.title: ... on my media center with an h80i v2 running perfect..
customer_reviews.text: installed on my media center with an h80i v2 running perfect....
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Baskin

customer_reviews.title: I would like to add a larger fan and heat sink
customer_reviews.text: I am having a problem with heat. The warranty state that you void the warranty if you do not use the fan and heat sink supplied. I would like to add a larger fan and heat sink.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Processor!
customer_reviews.text: Great little processor! Upgrade from an A6-5400K, and the change has been incredible. I can now run new games at medium to high graphics. The Dual Graphics is a very good feature, that has been very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kiehl

customer_reviews.title: Good processor!
customer_reviews.text: Quick processing and great onboard graphics. The price short of being given to me was a good value. I typically build in the 65 watt range and had heard the stock fan was lacking. I built with an after market heatsink/fan-120 mm and what is being exhausted from the case is cool air. I have loaded a hardware monitoring software but do not trust as it is all over the place. All in all I'm happy with the cpu.
customer_reviews.author: robroy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: It is an all around snappy processor. The price is similar to an Intel i3, but crushes any i3's graphics. The built in HD graphics love my 2400mhz ram. With the 2400 ram it really lets the built-in gpu shine.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Devilbiss

customer_reviews.title: good and fast
customer_reviews.text: GIGABYTE GA-F2A88XM-D3H FM2+ AMD A88X (Bolton D4) HDMI SATA motherboard was used with this chip and 8 gig of ram set it on fire. no issues with win 7 installed. I was impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny L Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: works for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: It is in a mini-ITX with 8gb ram, 2 HDMI ports (onboard), wireless-N, 2tb hard drive, 140mm water cooler. It is running Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. More than sufficient for light gaming, college coursework, video streaming, general browsing.
customer_reviews.author: James D Fuller JR

customer_reviews.title: Love this Quad Core Processor
customer_reviews.text: This processor is powerful and fast enough to do everything I need. I do some graphics work and this chip runs circles around my old 3.2 GH Pentium. I wish I had upgraded sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Davis

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Is Awesome!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was indeed a great purchase. The built in video card to my surprise works extremely well. I did not expect the high graphics quality it produces. The processor is lightning fast.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Excellent processor for the price. Can't beat AMD. Installation and set up very easy, the only complaint is the heat sink fan is a little smaller than I like.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for the budget gamer.
customer_reviews.text: I think, for the money, this is a really fine piece of hardware. The graphics are good enough to play all modern games, but don't expect to do so with highest settings.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ildefonso

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Excellent performance for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Excellent performance for the price. Coupled with 16g of RAM and a ~100$ video card this rig plays any video game out right now.
customer_reviews.author: Tobias L Merriman

customer_reviews.title: A10 AMD Chip
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Does run hot, go with some testosterone on cooling, works best with fast memory too.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Ghiglia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing power for just an APU
customer_reviews.text: Amazing power for just an APU. I can run games like The Crew or Battlefield 4 flawlessly at medium/high settings. For just a processor that is fantastic. I plan to pair this with a R9 for an unstoppable combo.
customer_reviews.author: Darian

customer_reviews.title: Good APU
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first computer build and it seems to work very well, may still need to crossfire with a graphics card but this does everything I need it to do for now.
customer_reviews.author: darkjedi7

customer_reviews.title: Great budget choice.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect CPU to base new build for Mom, has plenty of GPU power for casual gaming as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Performance per dollar!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid intel user but this APU it good. Used it a a workstation i built because of the price and i was surprised. Great bang for the buck!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick B.

customer_reviews.title: Its amd you get what you pay for awesome....
customer_reviews.text: great never had a problem with any amd cpu ....may up grade to the 7700k sooner or latter but right now don't see a need....
customer_reviews.author: bobby

customer_reviews.title: Impressive.
customer_reviews.text: Two months I push this CPU at its limits and I really impressed. I didn't buy my graphic card yet (EGVA 770GTX) so I use this CPU for the VGA and yeah this CPU AMD offert great performances with a better price than Intel. This is my first AMD CPU and certainly not the last one ;) =) _ Performances _ Good price. =( _ As usual a crappy stock fan included. I use a cooler system so don't need it. _ Not free.
customer_reviews.author: Aure

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor, not so amazing Graphics though.
customer_reviews.text: Graphics aren't that Amazing, but great. Minecraft - Max Settings - 40-60 FPS WoW - Medium Settings - 60 FPS Stable Shadow of Mordor - Lowest Settings - 20-30 FPS
customer_reviews.author: Fireguydude

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a dual core.......man what a difference. Amd has pretty decent processors if you know what to look for.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor. Installed in a Gigabyte MB F2A88X-UP4 with128GB ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Processor. Installed in a Gigabyte MB F2A88X-UP4 with128GB Kingston SSD drive and 8GB DDR3 Memory. Works flawlessly and FAST!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I put together a system with an a10-6800 AMD Quad core and 16 Gig of memory. I had put a Radeon HD 7700 in it but the video card failed so I had to pull it and send it back. The integrated video was able to play all my games at full graphics or slightly below an close to the same frame rates as the 7700!
customer_reviews.author: William Peake

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from A8 and this is really awesome updated my bios before replace/upgrading and works like a breeze than x again
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Santana

customer_reviews.title: Good !
customer_reviews.text: 100% AMD goodness. Great performance. Using this CPU for a FLEX RADIO (SDR) ham radio system.
customer_reviews.author: JX

customer_reviews.title: Best for upgrade your FM socket motherboard.(my old CPU A4 5300)
customer_reviews.text: Fast Shipping and more reliable then Taobao. Brand New CPU. Upgrade your FM socket CPU best choice.
customer_reviews.author: Azim Omar

customer_reviews.title: Little weak
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this CPU a little over a month ago and have to say its a little weak compared to similar CPU's on the market but I expected that. Performs well coupled with a Radeon 5770
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: AMD for life
customer_reviews.text: I've always been an AMD person, despite being a gamer. I end up putting AMD gpus and cpus in every system I build. So far so good, the person whom the system was built for loves it. AMD APUs are the future and I can't wait to see where AMD goes from here.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Davis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: THIS PROCESSOR IS FAAAAASSSSSTTTT AND I DO MEAN FAST. THANK YOU. SHIPMENT WAS FAST
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great APU for Amazing Price!
customer_reviews.text: These are not going to win any benchmarks anytime soon but put together correctly with a really good A85 mobo Hudson D4 and a good power supply. This thing will easily last you years of gaming. However, in the future you will need to upgrade to a Video Card and possibly RAM, but the new A85 supports up to 64 GBs of DDR3 dual channel RAM. If your looking to compete with the new Xbox 1 and PS4 then this would be a great builders choice to upgrade to the world of "real gaming" on computers. Lol. So much more freedom here in the PC world.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Brothers Solutions CEO

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best purchase i have made in a long time. Gets more flack than it should. It works amazingly with gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Julius Caesar Salad

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu
customer_reviews.text: Works 5 times better then my older processor which was an AMD A4-6300. Runs all my games alot smoother now. I don't regret this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Davis

customer_reviews.title: YOUR WHOLE GAMING PC IN OBE CHIP
customer_reviews.text: Your whole gaming PC in one chip.... I got this chip along with hyperblu 16000 8gb ran and 500 gb had it plays all games at medium to high settings! (Except gta4). I really thinks it's a great chip and I recommend you getting it.
customer_reviews.author: kennyolivess

customer_reviews.title: A whole PC-on-a-die
customer_reviews.text: The inside of my pc has never looked this uncluttered. This is now the most powerful machine in the house and the tiniest. This processor is phenomenal: not only the processing speed is state-of-the-art for all my usages, but the graphic card it provides packs a punch. Overall, it is the best bang for the buck around unless you are a power maven.
customer_reviews.author: Alessandro Catorcini

customer_reviews.title: Works for my HTPC
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my HTPC and it works 100% the way it was suppose to be. It works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Moe Kobeissi

customer_reviews.title: Sent back but it's still a great processor.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well but just got hot and I couldn't install my 212 evo cooler coy fan. Sent back but it's still a great processor.
customer_reviews.author: Tyree D.

customer_reviews.title: AMD I have faith in.
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is very fast and I am looking forward to my first large video editing production. I expect faster rendering and burning times for my customers.
customer_reviews.author: aliveinpr1

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Used this cpu in my first ever pc build and it works wonders. It plays every game in medium to high settings without fail. Long Live AMD
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this guy{) Man is it fast. I need more Power:)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: Very power low price
customer_reviews.text: Power power power it describes this amazing processor, every time amd wins in price Vrs quality, very easy installation woks perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Diego R.

customer_reviews.title: Good Low Level CPU/APU
customer_reviews.text: This card is properly labeled and marketed for what it is, but don't let the 4.4ghz frequency fool you, this card is for a low level computer when it comes to gaming. If you plan on getting a graphics card that as good or better than a GTX 660, this processor will bottleneck your GPU. In other words, if you are building a gaming PC on a less than $500 budget, this products is great but if your budget is bigger, go with an Intel i5 chip for $30 more and buy a good graphics card.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: perfect for powerful htpc
customer_reviews.text: Great processor for the money has more graphics power for most users and over clocks with ease, only thing though I wish and would package it with a better cooler like the stock cooler on my fx chip
customer_reviews.author: clint skinner

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor for Beginning PC Gamer
customer_reviews.text: Pros: For entry-level gaming, even with 1333mhz RAM, this thing is fantastic. It Maxes out Oblivion, and fear without hardly a stutter. As this is my first build I must say, well done, AMD. Cons: Runs hot, even with Arctic Silver 5 and a hyper 212 evo on top of it, I still get 60's under load and 40's at idle. However I don't know whether to call this a con just yet! P.s: Did a Handbrake video encode. The temps jumped from 40 to 95 FAST under 100% load. However this may be a software issue. I think this is a good purchase if you are new to building , or are just starting out in gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Oury

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very fast. Can play bf4 720p low settings at 60 fps (however your mileage may vary)
customer_reviews.author: Michael James Dooley

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and can't beat the price thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.text: What I expected!!! Good quality and can't beat the price thanks Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: The cpu comes with good pricing and it is all brand new
customer_reviews.text: The cpu comes with good pricing and it is all brand new. I was surpised that it arrives earlier than stated.
customer_reviews.author: michael yuen

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Fast for AMD, My computer never has a freeze up even for a split second. It's pretty good working for gaming too.
customer_reviews.author: Goose Grim

customer_reviews.title: Amd A10 apu is a great addition to any budget build
customer_reviews.text: EXACTLY what I paid for. Beautiful for budget gaming builds! Great for those unable to get discreet graphics right away
customer_reviews.author: Xzavier Price

customer_reviews.title: Good for Cheap Builds
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my new build fast possessor, and good for cheap 300$ builds.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: amd rocks
customer_reviews.text: for the money amd cant be beat and unless your a hardcore gamer that wants to play the last games at max setting this APU is for you
customer_reviews.author: David C Hill

customer_reviews.title: a10 6800k
customer_reviews.text: if your ion a budget good card but go for the newer a series kaveri, little more pricey but worth it
customer_reviews.author: Gritee

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: If you're a gamer or if you use the latest Adobe CS6 tools with OpenCL support or if you use any other OpenCL capable applications this one will beat all the CPUs available on the market today even the latest Intel's Haswell CPUs. That doesn't mean you won't get a super fast x86 processor, but the GPGPU is the strength of this product over Intel's.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad Harthi

customer_reviews.title: Over clocker's tweeker toy.
customer_reviews.text: This thing comes out of the box at a respectable 4.0 GHz and easily OC's to 5.0 by adding a good cooler and case fans. I don't recommend RAM any slower than 1600 MHz. The onboard graphics processing isn't bad either but if you're going to do any serious gaming then get a couple of SLI or Crossfire cards. I've always been an AMD fan and this processor puts a big smile on my face. I have this processor mounted on an ASUS A88X PRO Motherboard with a Cooler Master Hyper 212 Evo with a second fan on the cooler with 8 GB of Patriot Viper RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Zildjian71

customer_reviews.title: Its an AMD APU - You get what you pay for I suppose......
customer_reviews.text: I keep trying to find reasons to like an AMD CPU. The Intel LGA 1366 920 this build replaced TBH was as fast as this one IMO. I guess its good for a budget chip, but these APU's are not my first choice. It certainly needed a good cooler on it, these do get hot, so I put a Noctua air cooler on it as my wife didn't want water cooling in her rig - but it could use it. These APU's get hotter than I like a CPU to get.
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuy

customer_reviews.title: Fast, great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Fast, just Google AMD A10-6800K Overclocked To 8203.34 MHz, Breaks And Sets World Record, paired this with a 660 ti vid. card, 550 psu, 8gb 2400 ram, will be soon upgrading to 32 gb 2400 ram , and the Titan vid. next.
customer_reviews.author: t conner

customer_reviews.title: Good processor
customer_reviews.text: It runs really hot so you need a better heat-sink that the factory P.O.S. they send with it. I opted for a cooler-master Hyper 212. Stays cooler but it is still a hot processor Usually runs right under 80C while gaming on high. Liquid cooling would probably be the best alternative for this chip but for the price it is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Gloopglop

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Gaming PC
customer_reviews.text: For around $200 you'll get a midranged PC that can play all of todays titles like Battlefield 4 and many more. This is an awesome GPU! Pros: Plays all my games at max/almost max settings! (with AA and AF off or at 2x) MSI A78M-E35 FM2+ CRUCIAL 4GB DDR3 1600 PNY XLR8 SATA 6Gbps - 120GB SSD AMD A10-6800K with Radeon HD 8670D (gaming on High-Ultra settings on Skyrim, and many other games)
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Yale

customer_reviews.title: Great chip for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a server install works great. Love the price. Running windows 2012 server with 16 GB ram and 27 TB of storage. Also Makes a great Media center PC
customer_reviews.author: Paul G. Strahan

customer_reviews.title: good APU
customer_reviews.text: is faster and good graphis, the bad is fan embeded no cooling very good and very noise is better buy one new how cooler master 212
customer_reviews.author: león david bermudez

customer_reviews.title: AMD A10-6800K
customer_reviews.text: This APU is a impressive. Fast in general usage runs cool. Low price On-board GPU. Great with both DirectX 11.1 and OpenGL 4.2. Good entry level chip.
customer_reviews.author: Sultan

customer_reviews.title: Great APU
customer_reviews.text: Performed over expectations. Fast, great performance, and best of all hundreds of dollars cheaper than the nearest comparable Intel. Handles all my games with ease (also got an hd 7950 handling graphics) and soon to be combined with an ssd. Best bang for the money they're asking for. Recommending this for any first time gaming builds.
customer_reviews.author: Justin L

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Love it
customer_reviews.text: Had the 5800k .. I bought6800k playing battlefield 3 on ultra with a NVidia 650Ti believe it or not. Medal of honor ultra settings. Overclocking up to 4.7 stable it was well worth it ..Sold my 5800k on amazon for 90.00 so I only paid 70 or so dollars for this processor. The beta of Battlefield 4 just came out and that's playing on ultra settings also. This A10 6800K processor is well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: PLANET X'd

customer_reviews.title: My favorite  cpu
customer_reviews.text: It is a good cpu I love this technology, is affordable, and always been my tendency to get a computer parts from amd
customer_reviews.author: Reinaldo

customer_reviews.title: Super fast and a cool runner...
customer_reviews.text: This little baby plugged into my ASUS F2A85-V Pro mainboard along with the Samsung 250GB SSD and Kingston Hyper Beast 16GB memory made my newly built PC a work of art. I've used AMD for many years, and in my opinion, it's the best buy for the money. A solid APU.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Mayes

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but, maybe not the best choice.
customer_reviews.text: (sigh) just get an Intel. I don't really have much of a problem with this AMD cpu but my pc was on budget and it gets really hot. I've already planned my next build and it includes the Intel i5 4690k. Much better.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Daigler
